title: Inside the viral challenges that footballers have tried their best to perfect
text:

Zlatan Ibrahimovic may have failed to get his Matrix Challenge off the ground last week, but he's not the first sports star to get involved in a viral fad.

From the Ice Bucket Challenge to the Bottle Cap Challenge , athletes from a range of sports have not being shy in getting involved in various challenges and uploading their efforts to the web.

Some sports stars have opted to take the challenges seriously, while others have may have adopted a more light-hearted approach to their effort.

One thing, though, is for sure - it won't be too long before there is another viral challenge for them all to get involved in.

The Matrix Challenge

Launched by Ibrahimovic last week, this challenge involves participants performing in a style that mimics the famous scene from the 1999 film where protagonist Neo uses his slow-motion ability to dodge a series of bullets.

In his clip last week, the former Manchester United forward controlled a ball on his chest before keeping it there while he leaned back - all in slow-motion.

The ex-Barcelona attacker uploaded the clip to his Instagram page and challenged the likes of former team-mate Paul Pogba, tennis champion Novak Djokovic and UFC star Khabib Nurmagomedov to post their efforts online.

Sadly, it seems none of that trio were willing to join the former PSG striker in taking part in the challenge.

The Bottle Cap Challenge

This fad went viral earlier this summer, with athletes lining up to showcase their ability to knock the cap off a bottle using only a spinning kick.

Unsurprisingly, former two-weight UFC champion Conor McGregor was among those to successfully complete the challenge, as were the likes of ex-boxer Floyd Mayweather and Ibrahimovic.

The Ice Bucket Challenge

Going back a few years, this challenge was all the rage back in 2014 and saw athletes, as well as celebrities, pouring ice cold buckets of water over themselves.

One of the more memorable versions saw Jose Mourinho, having just returned to Chelsea for a second spell in charge of the Blues, let out a rather bizarre scream after being drenched.

The efforts were all for a good cause, though, with the challenge helping to raise awareness of motor neurone disease.

The Dele Challenge

This viral sensation was sparked by Tottenham midfielder Dele Alli's celebration after netting against Newcastle on the opening day of the 2018-19 Premier League season.

The England international seemed to cup his hand around his eye in a rather complicated way, with many attempting and most failing to replicate the celebration.

However, some were able to master it - including Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino and Mirror Sport's very own Joe Cooper.

The Mannequin Challenge

A fad that saw participants stay perfectly still while a camera panned around their surroundings, this fad became a favourite of football teams.

Many sides used it as a chance to offer an insight before closed doors, with some performing it in dressing rooms after games and others doing it in the gym at their training grounds.
description: From the Bottle Cap Challenge to the Ice Bucket Challenge, athletes have been kept busy by a host of viral fads in recent years
